item.title: Install Gnutls and compile Emacs from source
item.description: The lack of Gnutls in the environment If the current environment lacks Gnutls, the following configuration is required before compiling and installing the Emacs1 source code. ./configure --with-gnutls=no Or specify the installation directory at the same time, add the option to ignore other dependent libraries that are still missing, such as the following configuration. bash configure --prefix=$HOME/.local --with-gif=no --with-gnutls=no In this way, the configuration and installation can be carried out smoothly in the absence of permission to the default installation path, or the lack of various dependent libraries.
